section.p:
Thank you for taking the time to visit our website and for your interest in our schools.
It is my privilege to be the Superintendent of the Putnam Public Schools and I eagerly welcome you to our community of learners. Putnam is a special place because of the dedication of our staff, the commitment of the community as a whole, and above all, our students. Being a small district, we are able to personalize the learning experience, and the teachers get to know the students and their families.
Please take time to explore our website, to learn more about our schools, academic and extra-curricular opportunities and the resources accessible to students and families.
If you are an 8th grader exploring your high school options, please click here to learn more about Putnam High School.
Employment opportunities are located here and other relevant information can be found under the district tab.

If you have questions or need assistance that you were unable to address via the website, please contact your child’s building administration or my office directly. The Putnam Public Schools is a community that is passionate, empowered, and proud. If you don’t already belong, we hope you choose to join us.
Daniel P. Sullivan, III
Superintendent of Schools

section.p: If you need additional information, help in obtaining information or have an ADA compliance issue, please contact Daniel Sullivan, Superintendent of Putnam Public Schools at (860) 963-6900. Mr. Sullivan can also be reached by email. Currently, the district is conducting an audit of the website and working with its vendor to ensure compliance with the American with Disabilities Act. Thank you.

This website is meant to provide you with meaningful information concerning our school district. We hope you find this site useful. If you need additional information or help, please feel free to directly contact Mr. Sullivan, the Superintendent of Schools or any of our schools as well as our departments.
